risks.Risk Description: Cybersecurity is a ubiquitous concern with 78% of respondents indicating it is a high or very high risk in their organizations.

Risk Driver.Driver Description: Technology is identified as a common driver for high risks including cybersecurity.

risks.Trend: Audit plans maintain an elevated focus on cybersecurity with consistently high emphasis compared to previous periods.

risks.Risk Description: IT is identified as one of the top three risk areas, driven by technology factors.

Risk Driver.Driver Description: Technology factors are cited as key drivers behind the high risk ratings for IT.

risks.Contextual Variations: Publicly traded organizations rate IT risk lower compared to financial services organizations.

risks.Risk Description: Identified as the third highest risk area, with a notable gap—33 percentage points lower audit frequency than its perceived risk level.

Risk Driver.Driver Description: Reliance on technology and the use of third parties for IT services contribute to this risk.

risks.Contextual Variations: Publicly traded organizations tend to rate this risk lower than financial services organizations.

risks.Risk Description: Covers compliance and regulatory issues not related to internal controls over financial reporting.
risks.Contextual Variations: Publicly traded organizations report lower levels of this risk compared to financial services organizations.

risks.Risk Description: A defined risk area where recent audit allocations have decreased since 2019.
risks.Trend: Audit allocation for operational risk has decreased since 2019.

risks.Risk Description: Risk associated with enterprise risk management and related processes, as measured by survey respondents.
A key focus area where almost 90% of auditors integrate fraud considerations into audits and about half of CAEs are responsible for fraud investigations.
Risk related to governance and culture shows a 20 percentage point gap between perceived risk and audit frequency, suggesting potential under-auditing.
Pertains to internal controls over financial reporting, including SOX testing and compliance, with audit allocations influenced by SOX implementation status.
risks.Trend: For publicly traded organizations, audit allocation to financial reporting has decreased for the first time in three years.
risks.Contextual Variations: Audit allocations vary notably by SOX implementation status and organization type.

risks.Risk Description: Relates to cost/expense reduction, with a significant perceived risk—especially in nonprofit organizations—and a notable gap between risk perception and audit frequency.
risks.Trend: Audit allocation for cost/expense reduction is trending upward.
risks.Contextual Variations: Nonprofit organizations report higher levels of concern for this risk.

risks.Risk Description: Covers financial areas outside of internal controls over financial reporting, as assessed in the survey.
Pertains to sustainability and non-financial reporting, with a high percentage of organizations rating this area as moderate to very high risk.
risks.Trend: Audit allocation to this risk has increased since 2019.
risks.Contextual Variations: Publicly traded and public sector organizations exhibit heightened concern for this risk.

risks.Risk Description: A risk area where audit frequency for supporting external audits is 45 percentage points higher than the perceived risk level, indicating a potential over-auditing relative to risk.
